jsymbolic2.processing

Class FeatureConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.featureutils.FeatureConversion

  • public class FeatureConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenience class to allow features to be converted from one format to another. In particular, currently this class can convert a list of feature names to an array of boolean values. This array will be in the correct order, corresponding to what jSymbolic needs to perform its processing.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean[] initializeArrayFalse(boolean[] tempSave)
      Convenience method to initialize a boolean array to false.
      static boolean[] processFeaturesToSave(java.util.List<java.lang.String> saveFeatures)
      Processes the given saveFeatures list and returns a boolean array appropriately indexed based on the FeatureExtractorAccess indexing, where the index of features that need to be saved are marked as true, otherwise index is false.

      • initializeArrayFalse

        public static boolean[] initializeArrayFalse(boolean[] tempSave)
        Convenience method to initialize a boolean array to false.
        Parameters:
        tempSave - The array to be initialized to false.
        Returns:
        The tempSave array with all values initialized to false.

      • processFeaturesToSave

        public static boolean[] processFeaturesToSave(java.util.List<java.lang.String> saveFeatures)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Processes the given saveFeatures list and returns a boolean array appropriately indexed based on the FeatureExtractorAccess indexing, where the index of features that need to be saved are marked as true, otherwise index is false.
        Parameters:
        saveFeatures - Features that need to be saved.
        Returns:
        The appropriately indexed feature extractor boolean array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This is thrown if a feature name in the input list is invalid.
